subject: p16662264
History: -year-old female with IgG deficiency, asthma, diabetes. Evaluate for infiltrate.
Findings: Frontal and lateral radiographs of the chest demonstrate well expanded lungs. There is obscuration of the left border, which may represent early lingular pneumonia, and is not definitely seen on the lateral view. The cardiomediastinal and hilar contours are unremarkable. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.
Impression: Obscuration of the left heart border which may represent early lingular pneumonia, and is not definitely seen on the lateral chest x-ray.
